Articles.Content:
Hi Guys!

Just looking at CKAN and I must say how impressed I am with the number of mods now available for KSP.

Looking at some of the mods I'm interested in, such as Unmanned Before Manned, and under the Max KSP Version column it says 1.99.99?  Does this mean it'll work with any version of the game, or is/was there a version 1.99?  Looking at other mods and I see a couple which says they're compatible with version 9.99.99??  Really...  Version 9.99.99???  I really don't think there was a version 9 released, so what do these numbers mean?

Thanks all.

The versions 1.99.99 or 9.99.99 indicate the the author of the mod thinks that his/her mod is going to be compatible with all future version of KSP. This might be quite probable for mods that only add parts, flags or similar unless SQUAD decides to drastically change something (e.g. the wheel system)
They used versions 1.99.90 (or similar) to make sure that the mod can still be downloaded from CKAN after KSP updated even when the mod itself has not yet been updated or never will be updated.

There are also variants of that for e.g. 1.4.99 where the mod author thinks that the mod will be compatible with all patches for KSP 1.4 (1.4.1, 1.4.2 and so on)

My personal opinion about versions 1.99.99 or 9.99.99 is that this approach is quite risky and error prone. Should it be the case that an update of KSP unexpectedly breaks some parts the user is  lead to a false sense of security that everythink works only to find out that a vessel vanished or explodes because the mod does not work

On the other hand for patch updates (e.g. 1.4.99) this approach is reasonable

Edited April 23, 2018 by Nils277

Sometimes these are just incorrect if you look into it. E.g., one mod with such a max version is LaserDist, but if you look at its forum thread what you find is not a mod that's compatible with all KSP versions, but rather people complaining about version incompatibilities every time a new game version is released, followed by a recompile release, just like most plugins.

https://github.com/Dunbaratu/LaserDist/pull/23

Edited April 23, 2018 by HebaruSan

1 hour ago, Nils277 said:

My personal opinion about versions 1.99.99 or 9.99.99 is that this approach is quite risky and error prone. Should it be the case that an update of KSP unexpectedly breaks some parts the user is  lead to a false sense of security that everythink works only to find out that a vessel vanished or explodes because the mod does not work

Depends on the mod. Module Manager patches, or Contract Packs for example are almost certainly going to be compatible between KSP versions - as they have no code themselves, any problems would be in the mods that enable them.

There is of course the issue of updates to the dependencies breaking the mod, but that could happen outside KSP updates too.
Thanks for replying guys, I guess I'll just have to load them up and see what happens!  I really do like Unmanned Before Manned, along with the SETI parts that are necessary to make it work.
